title: The Smoking Gun Digital Bullet Journal
use: A customizable journaling application where users can store different kinds of information all in one place. Built mobile-first, this application allows users to stay organized both at home and on the go. It's easy to add, edit and delete lists, keep track of daily habits, manage calendars, throw thoughts into the journal or make doodles that users can save or download.
technologies: React, React Router, MongoDB, Mongoose, Express, Axios, Material UI, Firebase, FullCalendar, Chart.js, Geolocation, Gravatar, New York Times API, Weather API, Random Word API

title: PNW Whale Watching
use: A whale sighting application local to the Pacific Northwest that allows users to sign up and be notified when whales are spotted in the area. Users can post sightings, and pinpoint the location and upload an image if they choose, which will then notify other users via text and be displayed for others to see. There is also an information page with about local organizations in the area that aim to improve the lives of our local whale population.
technologies: Node, Express, MySQL, Sequelize, Handlebars, Passport, UIKit, Mapbox API, Multer, AWS S3, AWS SNS

title: What's for Dinner?
use: A recipe search application that allows users to search for recipes based on ingredients they have on hand with the ability to filter results by dietary preference. Users can then save the recipes they like or convert it to a PDF to be used offline or printed.
technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Foundation, Recipe Search and Diet API, PDF Layer API

title: Google Books Search
use: A book search application that allows users to search for various book titles and can then view the books on Google, save the books or, once no longer needed, delete them from their saved list.
technologies: React, MongoDB, Mongoose, React Router, Google Books API, Express, Axios, Bootstrap

title: Employee Directory
use: A directory application that displays all employees and allows users to then search for employees by name or sort them alphabetically either A-Z or Z-A.
technologies: React, Axios, Random User API, Bootstrap

title: Budget Tracker
use: A budget tracker application that allows users to keep track of their income and expenses, even when they do not have an internet connection. Users can input their income and expenses and view all the entries in table and on a graph.
technologies: IndexedDB, Service Workers, Web Manifest, MongoDB, Mongoose, Morgan, Node, Express

title: Team Generator
use: A command line application that allows users to create their team directory and later access this information all in one place. Results are then generated and displayed in a web application.
technologies: JavaScript, Node, Inquirer, Bootstrap, Font Awesome

title: Weather Dashboard
use: A weather search application that allows users to find out the current weather of a location along with the 5 day forecast. Users can also refer back to their previous searches.
technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, OpenWeatherMap API, localStorage

title: Day Planner
use: A simple calendar application that allows users to keep track of their day. Users can input and edit their entries by the hour, with the current hour highlighted, making it easy to know what's up next.
technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, localStorage, Moment.js
